page.title: 03St Peter's Church
page.content: The Saxon Cross, now preserved in the Church, was found in the Churchyard. It probably pre-dates the earliest church, and would certainly have been erected in a prominent position in the Village, and was the place where the travelling friars held services and preached the Christian faith. The first church in Barnburgh was built about 1150 A.D.It was quite small, and alterations were made in 1330 A.D.and 1410 A.D.which enlarged the Church to its present size. The church is the centre of the life of the village.Even the earlist church had a porch, and it was here that the Village Elders met to decide matters both religious and secular, affecting the Community.
